caption: The Paris that doesn't wait for you, small alleys where you can get lost among luxury and trinkets, rare objects and lots of history. From the cutlery where the dagger that killed Marat was bought, to the bar of the first meeting between Napoleon and Josephine. Go before it turns into a souvenir-only place :)
Sublime visit to the covered passages of Paris. We learned a lot about their history with humor and simplicity
To do Its passages are the charm of Paris

Yesterday Saturday January 9, passing through Paris, for a short stay, and given the very capricious and rainy weather, we decided to explore them... Beautiful discovery, rich in mosaic, tiling, sculpture, period facade .. For some... And for others, unfortunately sadder, darker and left in disuse... Too bad.. Be careful, some are private domains, so check the opening hours to access them.

Visited in the company of a guide. Magnificent places full of history
Nice covered passage discovered by chance, to transport us out of time.

This is the Paris of Napoleon III, where the French were well educated, the ladies in crinolines and the gentlemen in hats, the Paris of French chic and where the whole world came to dream of culture and love. These covered passages which made it possible to cross all of Paris dry, were a brilliant technical invention from Louis-Philippe which combined modernity and charm. There remain some vestiges of these passages still somewhat preserved, as if forgotten by the filthy mass of tourists, globalized merchants and the bad taste of the liberal libertarian left. These passages, like oases outside of time, combine the calm, luxury and voluptuousness of ancient France, radiant and modern, rooted and eternal. This alliance has disappeared and now what is modern is ugly and destructive.
Adorable, a very nice surprise. The miniature shops made me dream and the restaurants drooled...

“Les Passages Couverts de Paris 1” is a series of historic covered passages in Paris that combine antique beauty with unique charm. It represents a window into the city's romantic past. When you enter these corridors, you will feel as if you have entered a magical world. The corridors are surrounded by beautiful glass ceilings and artistic columns that add a fairytale atmosphere to the atmosphere. In addition, the lanes are adorned with many shops and small cafes serving delicious drinks and traditional French products. It is easy to get lost in these narrow and tangled lanes, and they offer a unique shopping experience away from the hustle and bustle. You can search for unique gifts and traditional French art objects. Overall, “Les Passages Couverts de Paris 1” is one of those hidden and special places in Paris, and it embodies the romance of the city and its cultural history. It is a must-visit place for travelers looking for a unique and charming experience in the heart of the French capital.
Be careful, some passages are closed on Sunday for those which are open, many shops closed but still a beautiful atmosphere

Magnificent covered passages between the grand boulevards, including Passage Verdeau built in 1847. These passages conceal real treasures, antique stores, old bookstores, famous tea rooms... And so many other things! It is a shame that in these historic places, for example, a Kilo shop or a Casino (store) is set up. This distorts the spirit of the place.
